clock up something.translation[0].defini: to reach or achieve a particular number or amount
The Dodgers have clocked up six wins in a row.
I clocked up 90,000 miles in my Ford.
Councillor Scott has clocked up more than 25 years on the borough council.
clock up something.translation[1].defini: to reach a particular number or amount
Thomas has clocked up 40 years service with the company.
The UK clocked up record exports of Â£4.3 billion.
